snippet: Rahul Gandhi doesn’t want to be closely identified with the government, author argues.
abstract: Rahul Gandhi doesn’t want to be closely identified with the government, author argues.
lead_paragraph: In July, Rahul Gandhi, general secretary of the Congress Party, said: “I will play a more proactive role in the party and the government. The decision has been taken, the timing is up to my two bosses: the Congress president and the prime minister,” Hartosh Singh Bal wrote in the Latitude blog. “He is expected to be anointed as No. 2, just below Sonia Gandhi, his mother and the party’s president, who is said to be ill,” and lead the Congress Party in the 2014 parliamentary elections.
